text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Tega Agbogidi

and I'm a Cloud architect
with AWS Managed Services.
I'm in a customer-facing role
and I talk to my customers very regularly,
like a couple of times a week.

I see the direct impact I have
on these customer businesses

and the changes they make,
making them cost-optimized,
making them well-architected on the cloud,
and they're very appreciative
of this impact we have on the business.
Growing up, I loved to build,
take things apart and put things together,
so I always now wanted to be an engineer.
As I proceeded with my career,
I still loved information technology

and AWS has given me the
opportunity to build stuff,

especially relating to
information technology.

I love inventing and AWS gives
me the opportunity to invent,

to create new things,
improve customer outcomes,
to help customer businesses
and to achieve their goals and objectives.
AWS keeps striving to improve diversity,
equity, and inclusion in the workplace
and I see this in the day-to-day meetings
and also things that put in place.

In AWS, we have a
different affinity groups

and one affinity group is a
Black Employee Network, BEN,

which I'm also a part of and
it's also been very helpful
to build relationships.

At that group I'm involved
with is a diversity,
equity, and inclusion group

and that group also has taught
me a lot about diversity,

given me different
perspectives and how to treat
and how to relate with everyone around me
so I felt I knew a lot about diversity,

but joining this group
gave me much more insight

about what diversity, inclusion,
and equity actually means.
There's amazing opportunity for growth.

I've been here three years and
I've actually switched jobs

and actually gotten
promoted in my current role.
So it is an amazing opportunity
for growth and I see a clear path.
I can actually plot what I want to do

over the next two, three
years along the way.

Anyone who is looking
for a fantastic career,

looking for growth opportunities,
looking to innovate,

looking to do some work
that's gonna impact the world,
I would say AWS is the place to be.
(upbeat music)
